docs.lead_paragraph: Though Web search is dominated by Google and supplemented by link-sharing on Facebook and Twitter, a start-up, Trapit, which opens to the public Tuesday, thinks it can offer a smarter, more personalized way to search for topics.
docs.abstract: Trapit, a start-up that opens to the public Tuesday, offers a new way to search the Web for topics by using machine learning. It is trying to provide an alternative to Google's search engine and link sharing on Facebook and Twitter.
docs.snippet: Trapit, a start-up that opens to the public Tuesday, offers a new way to search the Web for topics by using machine learning. It is trying to provide an alternative to Google's search engine and link sharing on Facebook and Twitter....

headline.main: A Start-Up Offers a New Way to Search the Web

docs.lead_paragraph: A refugee musician came to America in 1993 with her husband and daughter, practiced English and earned a degree in library science.

docs.lead_paragraph: Janet DiFiore came out ahead of Tony Castro in the Westchester district attorney's race last week by four percentage points and about 6,700 votes. It was a daunting lead for Ms. DiFiore, a Republican, given that there were only about 6,000 absentee and provisional ballots left to count. But Mr. Castro, a Democrat, said he would not concede until every last voting machine was checked and every ballot counted. Everybody else was eager to wrap up the game and go home, but there was Mr. Castro, alone in the end zone, looking up for his Hail Mary pass. What is he, nuts?
docs.snippet: Tony Castro is right to stand firm despite being behind in the tally of votes in the Westchester district attorney's race....

docs.lead_paragraph: The owner of The Chicago Tribune and The Los Angeles Times, previously known as Tribune Publishing, did not mention Gannett’s takeover attempt.
docs.abstract: Tronc, previously known as Tribune Publishing, raises its guidance for 2016 into range of $1.61 billion to $1.63 billion; reports second-quarter profit of $4 million, up from $1 million in year-ago quarter; revenue was $52 million, up 7 percent from year-ago quarter.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jun Hyuk Bang founded Netmarble Games in 2000 and has grown it into a powerhouse mobile gaming company with nearly $1 billion in annual revenue. Its game, "Seven Knights," has broken into Japan's list of top 10 mobile games.
